title: Subdomain Takeover uptime
content:
Hello Team:
i can't report it to the company so i hope to accept it as a valid bug , i found subdomain takeover in your subdomain uptime.btfs.io , i found this subdomain pointed to uptimerobot and not claimed so i signedup in uptimerobot and claimed it.
POC:
<image_0>
Impact
Subdomain takeover can be abused to do several things like : Malware distribution Phishing / Spear phishing XSS Authentication bypass Legitimate mail sending and receiving on behalf of ford subdomain
steps: Identify the subdomain uptime.btfs.io and check its DNS records to see if it points to a service like UptimeRobot.
If the subdomain is not claimed, sign up for UptimeRobot and claim the subdomain to demonstrate the takeover.
vuln_description: The subdomain uptime.btfs.io was found to be pointing to UptimeRobot but was not claimed, allowing an attacker to claim it and potentially abuse it for malicious purposes such as malware distribution, phishing, or other attacks.
reason: The vulnerability involves identifying an unclaimed subdomain and claiming it through a third-party service, which is a straightforward process without complex interactions or multiple components.

authnz_metadata.reasoning: The reported subdomain takeover vulnerability involves a misconfigured DNS record pointing to an unclaimed third-party service (Uptimerobot). The described methodologies focus on testing authentication/authorization boundaries within the application itself (e.g., swapping user sessions, manipulating resource IDs). Subdomain takeovers are infrastructure misconfigurations unrelated to application-layer AuthN/AuthZ logic, and thus not detectable via the proposed user-session/resource-ID substitution methods.
